intro: Cardaminopsis petraea, commonly known as the alpine buttercup, is a perennial herb native to alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow, cup-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in harsh, cold environments. Its leaves are basal, palmately lobed, and often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Cardaminopsis petraea is a low-growing plant with a compact habit, often forming dense mats in its natural habitat.
